event_type.category: Player Transfers, Trades, and Contract Signings

0.summary: A second-division women’s basketball team has filled its final roster spot before the domestic transfer deadline by signing its veteran point guard to a one-year extension with a reduced salary and incentives tied to games played following last season’s injury layoff.

outline.sentence: {Rivergate Rivets Women's Basketball Club|ORGANIZATION-1} signs {Elara Finch|PERSON-1} to a one‑year contract extension with a reduced base salary and performance incentives based on games played after {Elara Finch|PERSON-1}'s previous season's injury layoff.
The extension sets {Elara Finch|PERSON-1}'s base salary at $45,000 for the 2025‑26 season, with an additional $2,500 per game played beyond the first ten appearances.

{Midland Women's Basketball League|ORGANIZATION-2} officially records the registration of {Elara Finch|PERSON-1}'s extension with {Rivergate Rivets Women's Basketball Club|ORGANIZATION-1} before the domestic transfer deadline of 2025-03-20.
The league filed the contract under registration number {MWBL‑2025‑RIV‑EF|MISCELLANEOUS-1}, confirming compliance with the transfer deadline on March 20.

Coach {Dana Loris|PERSON-2} of {Rivergate Rivets Women's Basketball Club|ORGANIZATION-1} states that the terms of {Elara Finch|PERSON-1}'s extension provide roster stability while rewarding {Elara Finch|PERSON-1}'s availability post‑injury.

Coach {Dana Loris|PERSON-2} added in a press conference at the {Rivergate Sports Complex|BUILDING-1} that the incentive clause will activate only after {Elara Finch|PERSON-1} logs a minimum of 500 minutes on the court.

{Sundara Sportswear|ORGANIZATION-3}, the primary kit sponsor of {Rivergate Rivets Women's Basketball Club|ORGANIZATION-1}, releases a statement supporting the club's decision and notes that {Elara Finch|PERSON-1}'s marketability will be highlighted in upcoming promotional campaigns.

{Sundara Sportswear|ORGANIZATION-3} announced that {Elara Finch|PERSON-1} will appear in the upcoming “{Rise Together|MISCELLANEOUS-2}” winter apparel campaign, featuring a limited‑edition jersey released on April 5.

{Rivergate Rivets Women's Basketball Club|ORGANIZATION-1} announces that the reduced salary allocation from {Elara Finch|PERSON-1}'s extension frees cap space to sign a backup shooting guard before the season opener.
The freed cap space, estimated at $12,000, will be allocated to sign veteran guard {Maya Torres|PERSON-3} from the neighboring {Lakeside Lynx|ORGANIZATION-4} before the season opener on October 2.

continuation.summary: The limited‑edition “Rise Together” jersey showcasing Elara Finch hit store shelves on April 5, selling out its first 3,000 units within 48 hours.

1.summary: The limited‑edition “Rise Together” jersey showcasing Elara Finch hit store shelves on April 5, selling out its first 3,000 units within 48 hours.

outline.sentence: {Sundara Sportswear|ORGANIZATION-3} released the limited‑edition {Rise Together|MISCELLANEOUS-2} {Rise Together jersey|PRODUCT-1} featuring {Elara Finch|PERSON-1} on 2025-04-05 at the {Sundara Sportswear|ORGANIZATION-3} flagship store in {Sunvale|LOCATION-1}.

The jersey, crafted from 85% recycled polyester with a moisture‑wicking interior, was priced at $119 and the launch ceremony was attended by coach {Dana Loris|PERSON-2}, {Rivergate Rivets Women's Basketball Club|ORGANIZATION-1} mayoral representative, and local media.

The limited‑edition {Rise Together|MISCELLANEOUS-2} {Rise Together jersey|PRODUCT-1} sold out its initial allocation of 3,000 units within 48 hours at {Sundara Sportswear|ORGANIZATION-3} retail locations and the {Rivergate Rivets Women's Basketball Club|ORGANIZATION-1} online store.

Sales data show 1,820 units were purchased at the {Sunvale|LOCATION-1} flagship, 620 through the online store, and 560 at regional {Sundara Sportswear|ORGANIZATION-3} outlets, with 2,500 units sold in the first 24 hours.

{Rivergate Rivets Women's Basketball Club|ORGANIZATION-1} announced that all net proceeds from the limited‑edition {Rise Together|MISCELLANEOUS-2} {Rise Together jersey|PRODUCT-1} sales will be allocated to fund a free community basketball clinic in {Rivergate|LOCATION-2} scheduled for June 2025.

The club estimates net proceeds of approximately $180,000, which will fund a two‑day clinic at the {Rivergate Community Center|BUILDING-2} for up to 150 local youth, featuring coaching staff from the {Rivergate Rivets Women's Basketball Club|ORGANIZATION-1} and guest trainers.

{Elara Finch|PERSON-1} issued a public statement praising the limited‑edition {Rise Together|MISCELLANEOUS-2} {Rise Together jersey|PRODUCT-1} and confirming her participation in the upcoming community basketball clinic organized by {Rivergate Rivets Women's Basketball Club|ORGANIZATION-1}.

In her statement, {Elara Finch|PERSON-1} said, “Wearing this jersey reminds me of the fans who lift us every game, and I can’t wait to share skills and stories at the June 12 clinic,” confirming she will lead a shooting‑drills workshop.

{Sundara Sportswear|ORGANIZATION-3} confirmed a supplemental production run of 2,000 limited‑edition {Rise Together|MISCELLANEOUS-2} {Rise Together jersey|PRODUCT-1} jerseys to meet continued demand, with delivery planned for early May 2025.

The additional 2,000 jerseys will be manufactured at {Sundara Sportswear|ORGANIZATION-3}’s {Greenfield eco‑factory|BUILDING-3} and are scheduled to ship on May 3, 2025, to be stocked at the same retail locations and the online store.

continuation.summary: Maya Torres bruised her ankle in the Rivets’ second game on 4 October 2025, limiting her effectiveness and leading Coach Loris to cut her minutes rather than call up a rookie reserve.

2.summary: Maya Torres bruised her ankle in the Rivets’ second game on 4 October 2025, limiting her effectiveness and leading Coach Loris to cut her minutes rather than call up a rookie reserve.

outline.sentence: On 2025-10-04, during the {Rivergate Rivets Women's Basketball Club|ORGANIZATION-1}’s second league game at {Rivergate Sports Complex|BUILDING-1}, {Maya Torres|PERSON-3} suffered a bruised left ankle after landing awkwardly following a defensive rebound.
The injury occurred in the second quarter with 3:12 remaining on the clock, as {Rivergate Rivets Women's Basketball Club|ORGANIZATION-1} trailed the {Midland Mavericks|ORGANIZATION-5} 34‑28.
Medical staff at {Rivergate Sports Complex|BUILDING-1} evaluated {Maya Torres|PERSON-3}’s ankle and diagnosed a grade‑I contusion, prescribing rest and limited court time for a minimum of two weeks.

Team physician Dr. {Lina Ortiz|PERSON-4} performed a bedside ultrasound that confirmed no ligament tear and applied an ice compress and compression wrap before sending {Maya Torres|PERSON-3} to the on‑site physiotherapy suite.

Coach {Dana Loris|PERSON-2} of {Rivergate Rivets Women's Basketball Club|ORGANIZATION-1} announced that {Maya Torres|PERSON-3} will have playing minutes limited to twelve per quarter for the remainder of the season’s opening month.

The twelve‑minute cap per quarter translates to a maximum of 48 minutes per game, and the coaching staff will track {Maya Torres|PERSON-3}’s workload using the club’s wearable GPS and heart‑rate monitors.

Coach {Dana Loris|PERSON-2} decided not to activate rookie reserve {Leila Kade|PERSON-5}, a recent graduate of {Rivergate Academy of Sports|ORGANIZATION-6}, keeping {Leila Kade|PERSON-5} on the bench despite the reduced minutes for {Maya Torres|PERSON-3}.

{Leila Kade|PERSON-5}, a 5‑foot‑9 point guard who averaged 4.2 points and 2.1 assists in her final academy season, remains on the active roster and will continue to practice with the first‑team unit while awaiting a potential debut.

{Rivergate Rivets Women's Basketball Club|ORGANIZATION-1} issued an official statement confirming the injury protocol for {Maya Torres|PERSON-3}, emphasizing player health and the team’s commitment to compete at full strength once {Maya Torres|PERSON-3} recovers.

Communications Director {Sofia Marquez|PERSON-6} said, “Maya’s health is our top priority, and we will allocate a portion of the net proceeds from the {[Rise Together jersey][PRODUCT-1]} {[Rise Together jersey campaign][MISCELLANEOUS-3]} to support her rehabilitation program.”

continuation.summary: Dr. Lina Ortiz confirms that Maya Torres has completed her ankle rehabilitation and will start the season opener on 2025‑11‑05 as a member of the starting lineup.

3.summary: Dr. Lina Ortiz confirms that Maya Torres has completed her ankle rehabilitation and will start the season opener on 2025‑11‑05 as a member of the starting lineup.

outline.sentence: Dr. {Lina Ortiz|PERSON-4} announced at {Rivergate Sports Complex|BUILDING-1} that {Maya Torres|PERSON-3} had completed her ankle rehabilitation program on 2025-10-25.

The three‑week rehabilitation protocol, which combined aquatic therapy, proprioceptive drills, and weekly ultrasound assessments, was documented in a detailed medical report presented by Dr. {Lina Ortiz|PERSON-4} during the announcement.

{Rivergate Rivets Women's Basketball Club|ORGANIZATION-1} released an official roster update confirming {Maya Torres|PERSON-3} will be listed in the starting lineup for the season opener on 2025-11-05.

The roster update, posted on the club’s website and shared via {Twitter|ORGANIZATION-8} and {Instagram|ORGANIZATION-9}, lists {Maya Torres|PERSON-3} under jersey number 12 and confirms a 12‑player active roster for the opening game.

Coach {Dana Loris|PERSON-2} stated in a press conference at {Rivergate Sports Complex|BUILDING-1} that {Maya Torres|PERSON-3} is medically cleared and expected to play full minutes in the opening game.

Coach {Dana Loris|PERSON-2} added, “{Maya Torres|PERSON-3}’s conditioning metrics are back to pre‑injury levels, and we anticipate she will log at least 30 minutes in the game while the team executes our high‑tempo offense,” citing the latest GPS and heart‑rate data.

Communications Director {Sofia Marquez|PERSON-6} issued a media release noting that the starting‑lineup inclusion of {Maya Torres|PERSON-3} fulfills {Rivergate Rivets Women's Basketball Club|ORGANIZATION-1}’s commitment to player health and will be highlighted in pre‑game promotions.

{Sofia Marquez|PERSON-6}’s release also announced a fan meet‑and‑greet with {Maya Torres|PERSON-3} at the {Rivergate Community Center|BUILDING-2} on November 3, where a limited‑edition {[Rise Together][MISCELLANEOUS-2]} {[Rise Together jersey][PRODUCT-1]} featuring her signature will be available for purchase.

The season opener scheduled for 2025-11-05 will be held at {Rivergate Sports Complex|BUILDING-1}, featuring {Rivergate Rivets Women's Basketball Club|ORGANIZATION-1} versus {Midland Mavericks|ORGANIZATION-5}, with {Maya Torres|PERSON-3} slated to start.

Ticket sales have already reached 2,800 of the arena’s 3,200 capacity, and the game will be broadcast live on {Valoria Sports Network|ORGANIZATION-7} with a pre‑game analysis segment focusing on {Maya Torres|PERSON-3}’s return.

continuation.summary: On 2025‑11‑05 the Rivergate Rivets edged the Midland Mavericks 81‑74, with Maya Torres tallying 22 points and three assists in her season‑opening return.

4.summary: On 2025‑11‑05 the Rivergate Rivets edged the Midland Mavericks 81‑74, with Maya Torres tallying 22 points and three assists in her season‑opening return.

outline.sentence: The opening tip‑off of the {Rivergate Rivets Women's Basketball Club|ORGANIZATION-1} versus {Midland Mavericks|ORGANIZATION-5} took place at {Rivergate Sports Complex|BUILDING-1} and was broadcast live on {Valoria Sports Network|ORGANIZATION-7} at 7:00 PM.
The televised pre‑game segment featured analysis by former national‑team guard {Lucia Ortega|PERSON-7}, who highlighted {Maya Torres|PERSON-3}’ recent recovery progress.
{Maya Torres|PERSON-3} of {Rivergate Rivets Women's Basketball Club|ORGANIZATION-1} scored 22 points and recorded three assists in the season‑opening game.
{Maya Torres|PERSON-3}’ 22 points came from eight field‑goal attempts, including four three‑pointers, and she shot 62.5% from the free‑throw line.
Coach {Dana Loris|PERSON-2} of {Rivergate Rivets Women's Basketball Club|ORGANIZATION-1} confirmed that {Maya Torres|PERSON-3} played the full 40 minutes following her rehabilitation program.
Coach {Dana Loris|PERSON-2} noted that the wearable GPS data showed {Maya Torres|PERSON-3} maintained an average heart‑rate of 152 bpm throughout the game, matching her pre‑injury benchmarks.

Communications Director {Sofia Marquez|PERSON-6} of {Rivergate Rivets Women's Basketball Club|ORGANIZATION-1} announced that a limited‑edition {[Rise Together][MISCELLANEOUS-2]} {[jersey][PRODUCT-1]} featuring {Maya Torres|PERSON-3}’ signature will be available for purchase at {Rivergate Community Center|BUILDING-2}.

The limited‑edition {[Rise Together][MISCELLANEOUS-2]} {[jersey][PRODUCT-1]}, priced at $119, features {Maya Torres|PERSON-3}’ signature on the front left chest and a reversible navy‑gray color scheme, with all net proceeds earmarked for the upcoming June community clinic.
The final score was {Rivergate Rivets Women's Basketball Club|ORGANIZATION-1} 81, {Midland Mavericks|ORGANIZATION-5} 74, with ticket sales reaching 2,800 of the arena’s 3,200 capacity.
The attendance breakdown comprised 1,200 season‑ticket holders, 1,300 single‑game purchasers, and 300 walk‑in tickets sold at the gate on game day.

continuation.summary: Elara Finch hit a game‑winning three‑point buzzer‑beater in the Rivets’ 79‑77 overtime victory over the Central City Cyclones, boosting merchandise sales by 15% for the upcoming match.

passages: {Rivergate Rivets Women’s Basketball Club|ORGANIZATION-1} announced on March 15, 2025 that forward {Elara Finch|PERSON-1} has signed a one‑year contract extension. The deal reduces her base salary to $45,000 for the 2025‑26 season and adds a performance incentive of $2,500 for each game played beyond the first ten appearances, reflecting the terms set after her injury layoff last season.

The {Midland Women’s Basketball League|ORGANIZATION-2} has officially recorded the registration of {Finch’s|PERSON-1} extension with {Rivergate Rivets|ORGANIZATION-1}, confirming the move was lodged before the domestic transfer deadline of 2025‑03‑20.

Coach {Dana Loris|PERSON-2} of {Rivergate Rivets|ORGANIZATION-1} said the extension provides roster stability while rewarding {Finch’s|PERSON-1} availability post‑injury. {Sundara Sportswear|ORGANIZATION-3}, the club’s primary kit sponsor, also released a statement supporting the decision and noted that {Finch’s|PERSON-1} marketability will be highlighted in upcoming promotional campaigns.

1.headline: Sundara Sportswear Unveils Limited‑Edition “Rise Together Rise Together” Jersey, Funding $180K Youth Clinic in Rivergate
passages: On April 5, 2025, {Sundara Sportswear|ORGANIZATION-3} released a limited‑edition “{Rise Together|MISCELLANEOUS-2} {Rise Together|PRODUCT-1}” jersey featuring Valoria basketball star {Elara Finch|PERSON-1} at the {Sundara Sportswear|ORGANIZATION-3} flagship store in {Sunvale|LOCATION-1}. The jersey, part of {Sundara’s|ORGANIZATION-3} seasonal “{Rise Together|MISCELLANEOUS-2}” campaign that emphasizes unity and perseverance, showcases {Finch’s|PERSON-1} image and will be sold exclusively at the store.

{Rivergate Rivets Women’s Basketball Club|ORGANIZATION-1} announced that 100 percent of net proceeds from the jersey sales—estimated at roughly $180,000—will be directed to a free community basketball clinic in {Rivergate|LOCATION-2} scheduled for June 2025. The two‑day event at the {Rivergate Community Center|BUILDING-2} will serve up to 150 local youth and will be staffed by the {Rivets’|ORGANIZATION-1} coaching team together with guest trainers.

{Finch|PERSON-1} issued a public statement praising the limited‑edition jersey and confirming her participation in the clinic. “Wearing this jersey reminds me of the fans who lift us every game, and I can’t wait to share skills and stories at the June 12 clinic,” she said, adding that she will lead a shooting‑drills workshop for the attendees.

3.headline: Maya Torres Cleared to Return: Rivets Set to Feature Star Guard in Season Opener
passages: Dr. {Lina Ortiz|PERSON-4}, the sports‑medicine physician who works with the {Rivergate Rivets Women’s Basketball Club|ORGANIZATION-1}, announced at the {Rivergate Sports Complex|BUILDING-1} on October 25, 2025, that veteran shooting guard {Maya Torres|PERSON-3} has successfully completed a three‑week ankle rehabilitation program. The protocol combined aquatic therapy, proprioceptive drills, and weekly ultrasound assessments, all detailed in a medical report presented by Dr. {Ortiz|PERSON-4} during the press conference.

Following the medical clearance, Coach {Dana Loris|PERSON-2} held a press conference at the same venue, confirming {Torres|PERSON-3} is medically cleared, is expected to play full minutes, and will start in the upcoming season opener on November 5, 2025. “{Maya Torres|PERSON-3}’s conditioning metrics are back to pre‑injury levels, and we anticipate she will log at least 30 minutes in the game while the team executes our high‑tempo offense,” {Loris|PERSON-2} said, citing the latest GPS and heart‑rate data. The {Rivets|ORGANIZATION-1} have updated their roster to list {Torres|PERSON-3} in the starting lineup, ticket sales have already reached 2,800 of the arena’s 3,200 capacity, and the matchup will be broadcast live on {Valoria Sports Network|ORGANIZATION-7} with a pre‑game analysis segment focusing on her return.

Communications Director {Sofia Marquez|PERSON-6} also announced a fan meet‑and‑greet with {Torres|PERSON-3} at the {Rivergate Community Center|BUILDING-2} on November 3. Attendees will have the opportunity to purchase a limited‑edition Rise Together jersey bearing {Torres|PERSON-3}’s signature, further energizing the community ahead of the highly anticipated opening game.

used_items.N3-S7: {Sofia Marquez|PERSON-6}’s release also announced a fan meet‑and‑greet with {Maya Torres|PERSON-3} at the {Rivergate Community Center|BUILDING-2} on November 3, where a limited‑edition {[Rise Together][MISCELLANEOUS-2]} {[Rise Together jersey][PRODUCT-1]} featuring her signature will be available for purchase.
used_items.N3-S9: Ticket sales have already reached 2,800 of the arena’s 3,200 capacity, and the game will be broadcast live on {Valoria Sports Network|ORGANIZATION-7} with a pre‑game analysis segment focusing on {Maya Torres|PERSON-3}’s return.

unused_items.N3-S3: The roster update, posted on the club’s website and shared via {Twitter|ORGANIZATION-8} and {Instagram|ORGANIZATION-9}, lists {Maya Torres|PERSON-3} under jersey number 12 and confirms a 12‑player active roster for the opening game.
unused_items.N3-S6: Communications Director {Sofia Marquez|PERSON-6} issued a media release noting that the starting‑lineup inclusion of {Maya Torres|PERSON-3} fulfills {Rivergate Rivets Women's Basketball Club|ORGANIZATION-1}’s commitment to player health and will be highlighted in pre‑game promotions.
unused_items.N3-S8: The season opener scheduled for 2025-11-05 will be held at {Rivergate Sports Complex|BUILDING-1}, featuring {Rivergate Rivets Women's Basketball Club|ORGANIZATION-1} versus {Midland Mavericks|ORGANIZATION-5}, with {Maya Torres|PERSON-3} slated to start.

event_type.category: Player Transfers, Trades, and Contract Signings

4.headline: Rivets Edge Mavericks 81‑74 in Season‑Opening Showdown; Torres Leads with 22 Points
passages: The opening tip‑off of the {Rivergate Rivets Women’s Basketball Club|ORGANIZATION-1} versus the {Midland Mavericks|ORGANIZATION-5} took place at the {Rivergate Sports Complex|BUILDING-1}, a 3,200‑seat arena in Rivergate, and was broadcast live on {Valoria Sports Network|ORGANIZATION-7} at 7:00 PM. {The Rivets|ORGANIZATION-1} secured an 81‑74 victory, finishing the season‑opening game with a score of {Rivergate Rivets Women’s Basketball Club|ORGANIZATION-1} 81, {Midland Mavericks|ORGANIZATION-5} 74.

Veteran shooting guard {Maya Torres|PERSON-3} powered the {the Rivets|ORGANIZATION-1} with a standout performance, scoring 22 points on eight field‑goal attempts—including four three‑pointers—and shooting 62.5% from the free‑throw line while also dishing out three assists. Coach {Dana Loris|PERSON-2} confirmed that {Torres|PERSON-3} played the full 40 minutes following her rehabilitation program, noting that wearable GPS data showed an average heart‑rate of 152 bpm throughout the game, matching her pre‑injury benchmarks.

Attendance was strong, with 2,800 of the arena’s 3,200 seats filled. The crowd comprised 1,200 season‑ticket holders, 1,300 single‑game purchasers, and 300 walk‑in tickets sold at the gate, underscoring the community’s enthusiasm for women’s basketball in Valoria.

used_items.N4-S0: The opening tip‑off of the {Rivergate Rivets Women's Basketball Club|ORGANIZATION-1} versus {Midland Mavericks|ORGANIZATION-5} took place at {Rivergate Sports Complex|BUILDING-1} and was broadcast live on {Valoria Sports Network|ORGANIZATION-7} at 7:00 PM.

used_items.N4-S3: {Maya Torres|PERSON-3}’ 22 points came from eight field‑goal attempts, including four three‑pointers, and she shot 62.5% from the free‑throw line.

unused_items.N4-S7: The limited‑edition {[Rise Together][MISCELLANEOUS-2]} {[jersey][PRODUCT-1]}, priced at $119, features {Maya Torres|PERSON-3}’ signature on the front left chest and a reversible navy‑gray color scheme, with all net proceeds earmarked for the upcoming June community clinic.
